content:
• Friday, January 18, 2013
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) will take a noncash impairment charge of $580M ($0.87/share) in Q4 after...

    Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) will take a noncash impairment charge of $580M ($0.87/share) in Q4 after an internal investigation revealed accounting misconduct at recently acquired company Siwei Mechanical & Electrical Manufacturing Co. CAT -1.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM | 26 Comments
  • REE

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: REE +3%. XLNX +2%. IOC +2%. JCI +2%. THC +1%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: REE +3%. XLNX +2%. IOC +2%. JCI +2%. THC +1%.
    After-hours top losers: HALO -3%. UNIS -2%. VIRC -2%. OIBRC -2%. ORCC -1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • UTX

    United Technologies (UTX +0.5%) finishes the day in the green after announcing earlier that it's...

    United Technologies (UTX +0.5%) finishes the day in the green after announcing earlier that it's reached an agreement to sell its former Goodrich pump and engine control systems business to Triumph Group (TGI +3.8%). The deal is expected to close in Q113. The sale of the unit was one of the divestitures required by regulatory authorities as a condition of UTX's acquisition of Goodrich Corporation.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • ARCH

    Sterne Agee predicts a cyclical pricing recovery for coal, driven by favorable inventory trends....

    Sterne Agee predicts a cyclical pricing recovery for coal, driven by favorable inventory trends. It sees coal markets continuing to bottom in H1, while "producer discipline, economic/industrial activity improvement and fiscal efforts globally should support cyclical recoveries" in power-plant and steel-making coal in H2 and 2014. ACI +7.6%, ANR +2.4%, BTU +2.4%, JRCC +10.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 10 Comments
  • SSYS

    3D printer makers Stratasys (SSYS +4.4%) and 3D Systems (DDD +4.2%) are closing the week with...

    3D printer makers Stratasys (SSYS +4.4%) and 3D Systems (DDD +4.2%) are closing the week with solid gains, even though JPMorgan launched coverage on Stratasys with a Neutral and $86.50 PT. Nokia's 3D printing announcement could be stoking investor enthusiasm ... or we might just be seeing some end-of-the-week short-covering. 42.1% of 3D's float, and 9.1% of Stratasys' float, was shorted as of Dec. 31.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 4 Comments
  • SLB

    Schlumberger (SLB +4.3%) is up strong after reporting Q4 earnings that came in higher than...

    Schlumberger (SLB +4.3%) is up strong after reporting Q4 earnings that came in higher than expected after the gloomy guidance it provided just a month ago. While some analysts like SLB's solid performance amid a challenging period for oil service companies, Weeden's Michael Purves suggests investors cash out of the volatile stock and "wait for re-entry points."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • AZZ

    AZZ Inc. (AZZ -3.5%) gives an update on its FY14 fiscal year that comes in below Street...

    AZZ Inc. (AZZ -3.5%) gives an update on its FY14 fiscal year that comes in below Street estimates, although the company still projects its 27th consecutive year of profitability. It now expects to earn around $2.50 to $2.75 per share on revenue of between $625M to $660M. Analysts forecast an EPS of $2.80 on revenue of $680M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (AMRN -7.8%) comes under pressure after the FDA's update to its Orange Book gives it's...

    Amarin (AMRN -7.8%) comes under pressure after the FDA's update to its Orange Book gives it's fish oil pill Vascepa "no unexpired exclusivity," though no NCE decision was made.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 4 Comments
  • AGO

    Assured Guaranty (AGO +3.3%) stages a major reversal after disputing in great detail Moody's...

    Assured Guaranty (AGO +3.3%) stages a major reversal after disputing in great detail Moody's downgrade earlier today. "Moody's actions now appear to be determined by unsupported qualitative factors and assumptions ... that have little or no relevance ... There is a serious flaw in the rating process." The board approves a $200M stock repurchase program, replacing an old program (which had about $45M left to go). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • MNST

    Monster Beverage (MNST -4.7%) slips lower on persisting concerns over the impact of energy...

    Monster Beverage (MNST -4.7%) slips lower on persisting concerns over the impact of energy drinks. Three members of Congress have sent letters to companies in the industry requesting more information on their products and advertising claims, according to the WSJ. A rumor is also circulating around that the company could be Einhorned.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 3 Comments
  • BWEN

    This afternoon's spike in shares of Broadwind Energy (BWEN +6.7%) is attributed to a...

    This afternoon's spike in shares of Broadwind Energy (BWEN +6.7%) is attributed to a determination by the U.S. International Trade Commission that wind towers from China and Vietnam are sold in the U.S. at less than fair value and injure the U.S. industry. As a result, the Commerce Department says it will issue anti-dumping and countervailing duties.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • MS

    "We see a clear path to meeting and then exceeding our cost of equity," says Morgan Stanley (MS...

    "We see a clear path to meeting and then exceeding our cost of equity," says Morgan Stanley (MS +7.3%) CEO Gorman on the conference call (transcript). The first order of business will be getting regulatory approval to acquire the rest of Smith Barney - wealth management had a pre-tax margin of 17% in Q4, ahead of a 15% goal. In the areas of risk-asset and expense reduction, the bank is also well ahead of its goals. (earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • ANV

    Allied Nevada (ANV -3.9%) says it achieved record gold production of nearly 47K oz. in Q4, up...

    Allied Nevada (ANV -3.9%) says it achieved record gold production of nearly 47K oz. in Q4, up 55% Q/Q, and expects FY 2013 production of 225K-250K oz. But Q4 production fell short of guidance due to slower-than-expected leach kinetics from Bay pit material placed on leach pads in Q3-Q4, and extremely cold and wet weather in December.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • COL

    Rockwell Collins (COL -0.9%) slips today despite its FQ1 beating across-the-board earlier this...

    Rockwell Collins (COL -0.9%) slips today despite its FQ1 beating across-the-board earlier this morning. Net earnings edged up 1.5% Y/Y as the company recorded a smaller income-tax expense, which helped offset a slight drop in sales. The company also raised its FY13 guidance as a result of an R&D tax-credit extension, and is now looking for per-share earnings between $4.45 and $4.65, compared with its prior outlook of $4.30 to $4.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT +1.7%) says that the head of its Mining Products Division, Luis de Leon, is...

    Caterpillar (CAT +1.7%) says that the head of its Mining Products Division, Luis de Leon, is leaving the company to pursue other opportunities. Mr. de Leon joined CAT in June 2011 upon completion of it's acquisition of Bucyrus International, where he was COO.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • AKRX

    Shares of Akorn (AKRX -1.8%) slip after projecting its 2013 EPS to come in below Street...

    Shares of Akorn (AKRX -1.8%) slip after projecting its 2013 EPS to come in below Street estimates, despite forecasting record revenue as the niche pharmaceutical company boosts its product pipeline. It now expects to earn $0.57 to $0.61 per share, versus expectations of $0.66. Revenue is anticipated at $325M to $335M, in line with analysts projections of $331M. Read the transcript of the guidance conference here: (Transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • GFED

    Midday top 10 gainers: GFED +19%. DOM +12%. BTUI +11%. LIFE +11%. ONP +10%. ZA +10%. SGOC +9%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: GFED +19%. DOM +12%. BTUI +11%. LIFE +11%. ONP +10%. ZA +10%. SGOC +9%. DQ +9%. MOV +9%. PRTS +9%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: OTCPK:TELOZ -10%. HMNY -10%. TESS -9%. VOC -9%. COF -8%. CTC -8%. SINO -8%. TSRX -7%. BOSC -7%. FNSR -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • TSLA

    SolarCity (SCTY +6.2%) is rallying strongly for the second day in a row; today's move could be...

    SolarCity (SCTY +6.2%) is rallying strongly for the second day in a row; today's move could be assisted by favorable remarks from Jim Cramer. "I was negative about SolarCity, but now I think it is an interesting play. I'm thinking this is a good company and a Buy," said the excitable Mad Money host during last night's show.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 3 Comments
  • QLIK

    Qlik (QLIK +2.6%) rallies on an upgrade to Buy from Goldman: the firm thinks license revenue...

    Qlik (QLIK +2.6%) rallies on an upgrade to Buy from Goldman: the firm thinks license revenue growth is accelerating and can stay above 20%, and now has more confidence in the business intelligence software maker's ability to execute. Shares edged lower yesterday following a downgrade to Hold from Stifel, and have tread water for months after falling in 1H12 on worries about Qlik's European exposure. Q4 results are due on Feb. 14.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • CONE

    After setting an IPO price of $19, CyrusOne (NASDAQ:CONE) opened at $21.01 and is currently at...

    After setting an IPO price of $19, CyrusOne (NASDAQ:CONE) opened at $21.01 and is currently at $20.91, up 10.1%. That gives the data center owner, which sold 16.5M shares in its offering and (like many peers) is growing at a decent clip, a market cap of $1.3B. CyrusOne is being spun off by Cincinnati Bell (CBB -4.2%), which owns 71.6% of the company post-IPO. (previous) (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • VVUS

    Two Vivus (VVUS -2.6%) shareholders are raising a number of concerns about the company,...

    Two Vivus (VVUS -2.6%) shareholders are raising a number of concerns about the company, including its Qsymia launch, declining share value, and lack of revenue guidance. First Manhattan Co. and First BioMed Management Associates own respective stakes of 7.2% and 2.3% in VVUS, and say they initially bought the shares because they believed the company "represented an attractive investment opportunity." However, recent events have raised concerns about "the strategic direction of its management."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 2 Comments
  • ULTI

    In addition to downgrading cloud ERP/CRM software vendor NetSuite, Goldman is changing its...

    In addition to downgrading cloud ERP/CRM software vendor NetSuite, Goldman is changing its stance on two cloud HR plays: Ultimate Software (ULTI -2.1%) has been downgraded to Neutral, and Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +4.2%) upgraded to Buy. Though still positive on ULTI's long-term potential, Goldman isn't crazy about its valuation at current levels. The firm predicts Cornerstone's core business growth will accelerate, and (like Pac Crest) is positive on its Recruiting Cloud product.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • INTC

    Intel (INTC -6.3%) is getting battered due to the Q1 guidance and 2013 capex forecast provided...

    Intel (INTC -6.3%) is getting battered due to the Q1 guidance and 2013 capex forecast provided with its Q4 report, and is taking AMD (AMD -6.4%) along for the ride. FBR: "Investors worry about stagnant or shrinking unit shipments while Intel simultaneously ramps capacity spending meaningfully." The firm thinks Intel's spending could increase its annual depreciation by $4B, producing an 800 bps hit on gross margin. Also, many analysts are skeptical about Intel's full-year revenue forecast. NVDA -1.2%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • INO

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals (INO +2.8%) bucks a lackluster tape to trade higher after Piper Jaffray...

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals (INO +2.8%) bucks a lackluster tape to trade higher after Piper Jaffray initiates coverage with an Overweight. Piper notes the company is developing a novel DNA-based vaccine platform that is demonstrating "provocative" immune responses in early studies against a multiplicity of non-viral oncology targets, as well as several infectious diseases such as HIV, HCV, HPV, and the flu. The firm adds that multiple Phase II catalysts are expected this year in its HCV and leukemia platforms.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • STT

    More on State Street (STT +6.4%) Q4 earnings: It's a tale of two custodial banks as State Street...

    More on State Street (STT +6.4%) Q4 earnings: It's a tale of two custodial banks as State Street continues its recent divergence from BNY Mellon. Net interest margin of 1.36% vs. 1.44% in Q3, 1.40% a year ago (BK declined 18 bps Y/Y to 1.09%). The firm continues cutting costs, announcing 630 job cuts in its SEC filing.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • CRZO

    Credit Suisse cuts its ratings and price targets on three smaller oil producers: Carrizo's (CRZO...

    Credit Suisse cuts its ratings and price targets on three smaller oil producers: Carrizo's (CRZO -2.5%) leverage is too high to be overcome in terms of creating long-term value, Kodiak's (KOG -1.3%) share price has been propped up by the company's frequent mention as a takeover target, and Whiting's (WLL -2.2%) future growth is being driven by projects with diminishing returns.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 4 Comments
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks (PANW +1.6%) rallies after Goldman adds the next-gen firewall vendor to its...

    Palo Alto Networks (PANW +1.6%) rallies after Goldman adds the next-gen firewall vendor to its Conviction Buy list and sets an $80 PT. Talks with PANW resellers, customers, and partners leave Goldman confident the company is successfully displacing "legacy" firewall vendors (i.e. Cisco, Juniper, Check Point), and that growth will hit an inflection point in 2013. PANW barely moved on Wednesday following a 36M-share lockup expiration.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • OSIS

    OSI Systems (OSIS +4.23%) moves up today after saying that its reached an agreement with the TSA...

    OSI Systems (OSIS +4.23%) moves up today after saying that its reached an agreement with the TSA regarding the Rapiscan Imaging Technology systems and Automated Target Recognition software, in response to a “show cause” letter it received from the agency in November. Under the terms of the agreement, Rapiscan unit will no longer provide software development for body-scanning machines used in U.S. airports but will continue to provide the imaging systems.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • MRK

    Antibacterial-drug developer Trius Therapeutics (TSRX -8.22%) slips after pricing a 6.3M share...

    Antibacterial-drug developer Trius Therapeutics (TSRX -8.22%) slips after pricing a 6.3M share secondary offering at $4.75 a share, a 9% discount to yesterday's close. The company made the announcement late yesterday without any details as to its size or scope. TSRX has a market cap of around $213M with a 39.4M share float.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • ODP

    Office Depot (ODP +5%) trades higher with the office supply chain drawing closer to a Tuesday...

    Office Depot (ODP +5%) trades higher with the office supply chain drawing closer to a Tuesday deadline which will determine how aggressive Starboard Value will be in pushing for changes through a proxy fight. For the year, shares of ODP are up 35%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • N

    NetSuite (N -2.2%) slumps after getting downgraded to Neutral by Goldman and yanked from the...

    NetSuite (N -2.2%) slumps after getting downgraded to Neutral by Goldman and yanked from the firm's Conviction Buy list; valuation is cited. The provider of cloud ERP/CRM/e-commerce software has had a nice run-up over the last 8 months. (Retail Anywhere purchase)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • NCLH

    Shares of Norwegian Cruise Lines (NASDAQ:NCLH) open trading at $25.10 after the company priced...

    Shares of Norwegian Cruise Lines (NASDAQ:NCLH) open trading at $25.10 after the company priced its IPO at $19. The public debut of the cruise operator has some bearing on Royal Caribbean (RCL -0.1%) and Carnival (CCL +1.9%) with the sector gaining a peer to raise its profile.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • VIAV

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU -2.3%) and Oclaro (OCLR -2.7%) fall after rival Finisar (FNSR -6.2%) gets hit...

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU -2.3%) and Oclaro (OCLR -2.7%) fall after rival Finisar (FNSR -6.2%) gets hit with a downgrade to Underperform from Jefferies over the adoption of silicon photonics tech. Earlier this week, Intel announced its silicon photonics solution, which can enable short-range 100G Ethernet links, would be used in Facebook's increasingly popular Open Compute data center platform. Also: JDS test equipment rival Ixia (XXIA -2.7%) has been downgraded to Neutral by Lazard, which cites valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 2 Comments
  • BIDU

    China's strong Q4 GDP numbers fuel a rally in some Chinese Internet stocks. BIDU +1.9%. SINA...

    China's strong Q4 GDP numbers fuel a rally in some Chinese Internet stocks. BIDU +1.9%. SINA +3.2%. RENN +1.8%. YY +2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • FNSR

    Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR) is downgraded to Sell by Jefferies' James Kisner, also cutting his price...

    Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR) is downgraded to Sell by Jefferies' James Kisner, also cutting his price target by a whopping $6.50 to $7.50. "The commercialization of highly deflationary silicon photonics technology in the data center is likely no longer in doubt," he writes, and that's bad news for Finisar's Datacom business. Shares -9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • GERN

    Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) +5.4% after an upgrade to Buy with $3 price target by Piper Jaffray's...

    Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) +5.4% after an upgrade to Buy with $3 price target by Piper Jaffray's Charles Duncan. The current price of $1.66 reflects past challenges, he says, but leaves room for substantial upside over the course of the next year. That Geron and INO are buys at Piper while ZIOT and THLD are Holds does not compute, says Dan Rosenblum. Sell-side games, says TheStreet's Adam Feuerstein.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • TEVA

    Premarket gainers: PATH +16%. LIFE +12%. NEWL +8%. RIMM +8%. MS +7%. SNE +7%. GERN +5%. Losers:...

    Premarket gainers: PATH +16%. LIFE +12%. NEWL +8%. RIMM +8%. MS +7%. SNE +7%. GERN +5%.
    Losers: FNSR -10%. TSRX -9%. WIT -8%. COF -7%. INTC -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 2 Comments
  • SIRI

    A new era for Sirius XM Radio (NASDAQ:SIRI) officially launches with all eyes on how a battle...

    A new era for Sirius XM Radio (NASDAQ:SIRI) officially launches with all eyes on how a battle between SIRI shorts and Liberty Media (LMCA) buybacks will play out. With automobile sales forecast to be strong in 2013, some analysts are starting to think the company could issue a guidance surprise to the upside when it reports on Q4 on February 5. SIRI +1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM | 6 Comments
  • TMO

    Life Technologies (NASDAQ:LIFE) +13.5% premarket after the board hires Deutsche Bank and...

    Life Technologies (NASDAQ:LIFE) +13.5% premarket after the board hires Deutsche Bank and Moelis to assist in its annual strategic review. Chatter on pricing in an LBO has been in the $65-$75 range, but Jefferies says this is overly ambitious, and $50-$60 is more likely. Is Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) interested after Illumina has fallen through?

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • RIO

    Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO) +2.4% premarket, bouncing back from yesterday's loss, after chairman Jan du...

    Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO) +2.4% premarket, bouncing back from yesterday's loss, after chairman Jan du Plessis tells FT the company plans to diversify from its core iron ore business despite acquisitions that caused big writedowns and the ouster of its CEO. A top near-term priority for the new boss will be ensuring that RIO's Oyu Tolgoi copper project in copper in Mongolia reaches production on schedule.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM

  • Albert Fried attempts to rain on Netflix's (NLFX) parade with a harsh downgrade to Underweight...

    Albert Fried attempts to rain on Netflix's (NLFX) parade with a harsh downgrade to Underweight and price target of $68. The firm calls the recent rally a "reflexive speculative bubble." So far, a promising upgrade from Janney Capital is carrying more weight, NFLX +2.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM
  • AGO

    Assured Guaranty (NYSE:AGO) -4.5% premarket after a 2-notch downgrade to Baa2 by Moody's. The...

    Assured Guaranty (NYSE:AGO) -4.5% premarket after a 2-notch downgrade to Baa2 by Moody's. The industry has yet to recover from the financial crisis, says Moody's, and will continue to struggle as municipalities are doing just fine borrowing without insurance. A buyer beginning in 2008, Wilbur Ross now has a 10.2% stake in the firm.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • SNE

    Shares of Sony (NYSE:SNE) follow up on their big day in Japan with a rapid-fire 7.1% rise in...

    Shares of Sony (NYSE:SNE) follow up on their big day in Japan with a rapid-fire 7.1% rise in premarket trading in the U.S. Though a plan to sell a skyscraper in NYC for a cool $1.1B is a major impetus for the wave of buying, top exec Kazuo Hirai has been aggressive all week on selling the prospects of Sony to capitalize on synergies between its various business units.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • NFLX

    Shares of Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) get a lift off of a Janney Capital upgrade to Buy, gaining 3.1%...

    Shares of Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) get a lift off of a Janney Capital upgrade to Buy, gaining 3.1% premarket to clear $100 again. With all the concerns over what Icahn and Einhorn might or might not do, Janney focuses on the fundamental side by noting that the Disney deal and a brewing partnership with Sony could help improve Netflix's earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • COF

    Capital One (NYSE:COF) gets cuts to Hold at Janney and raised to Buy at Susquehanna following...

    Capital One (NYSE:COF) gets cuts to Hold at Janney and raised to Buy at Susquehanna following last night's disappointing earnings report. The bears hold the day so far - shares -6.3% premarket. Quick take: The stock's at a lofty level, the economy is sluggish, and the raised payroll tax means the company's strapped customers just had a chunk lopped off their paychecks.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM
  • BB

    Research in Motion (RIMM) +6.7% premarket after getting another upgrade from Jefferies' Peter...

    Research in Motion (RIMM) +6.7% premarket after getting another upgrade from Jefferies' Peter Misek, this time to Buy with price target of $19.50 (from $13). The new BB10 OS will enable corporate email on iOS and Android devices, he says - something the market is unaware of. In the most bullish scenario, he puts a $56 price target on the stock vs. a previous $43.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM | 11 Comments

  • U.S. stock futures are fairly flattish and apparently not overly excited by China's Q4 GDP...

    U.S. stock futures are fairly flattish and apparently not overly excited by China's Q4 GDP beating expectations. German shares, meanwhile, have turned red after being higher earlier. The Chinese data "has the potential to keep the general sentiment upbeat, although the threat of overzealous policy tightening remains a risk," says market strategist Fawad Razaqzada. Dow +0.1%. S&P +0.1%. Nasdaq -0.1%. Crude -0.15% to $95.35. Gold flat at $1690.70.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 AM

  • Asian and European stocks are uniformly higher after strong housing and labor data out of the...

    Asian and European stocks are uniformly higher after strong housing and labor data out of the U.S. and better-than-expected Chinese GDP, while Japanese shares also rising sharply on continued speculation about how much the BOJ will ease when it holds a policy meeting next week. Japan +2.9%, Hong Kong +1.1%, China +1.4%, India +0.2%. EU Stoxx 50 +0.1%, London +0.3%, Paris +0.2%, Frankfurt +0.1%, Madrid +0.4%, Milan +0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 AM
